sentences.english: Qin Shan people, with great mind, are stretch out their arms greeting friends from all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 秦山人以博大胸怀，张开双臂迎接世界朋友的到来。

sentences.english: Marius' two arms were passed round his neck, and the former's feet dragged behind him.
sentences.chinese: 马吕斯的双臂围着他的脖子，双足在他后面挂着。

sentences.english: Two arms strech out naturally, even with one rope connecting two hands.
sentences.chinese: 用一根绳子绑住两只手，双臂依然能够展开。

sentences.english: Flora manhood had to shift her dead arm .
sentences.chinese: 弗洛拉曼胡德把发麻的双臂交换了一下位置。

sentences.english: Occasionally, a wisp gusts of wind from the garment place slip in company with my arms.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔，几缕瑟瑟的风从衣摆处溜进来与我的双臂为伴。

sentences.english: Personally, I would welcome such a policy imperative with wide-open arms.
sentences.chinese: 我个人张开双臂欢迎这种必要的政策目标。

sentences.english: Hermione, however, leaned against the Owlery wall, folded her arms, and frowned at Ron.
sentences.chinese: 赫敏靠在棚屋的墙上，抱着双臂，对罗恩皱起了眉头。

sentences.english: On the one hand it embraces the new.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，它常常张开双臂拥抱新技术。

sentences.english: Wrap a strap around sole of the foot and hold with straight arms.
sentences.chinese: 将瑜伽带缠绕在脚掌上，双臂伸直保持。

sentences.english: Stretch your arms over your head.
I see them longing and reaching out for authentic community.
sentences.chinese: 我看到他们渴望并向可信的集体张开双臂。

sentences.english: Pezzo crosses the line with arms up celebrating victory.
sentences.chinese: 佩佐冲线，双臂高举庆祝胜利。

sentences.english: Arms folded in rest, women look over Cairo as they chat.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们把双臂搭在窗口上聊天时望向开罗。

sentences.english: When her son took off his shirt, she discovered that his arms were black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 当他儿子脱下衬衫时，她发现他的双臂受伤而发紫。

sentences.english: Soak your arm in warm water.
sentences.chinese: 将你的双臂浸泡在温水中。

sentences.english: He sat down heavily, his shoulders drooping, his arms falling between his outspread legs.
sentences.chinese: 他颓然坐下，肩膀耷拉着，双臂垂在叉开的。

definition: the five fingers of one's hand
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
